intro: Galium verosimile, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring and summer months. Galium verosimile is native to various regions in North America and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a common sight in moist, temperate habitats.
